titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices and Council, a proclamation Charles Porter, Tho. Coningesby. Whereas the vintners and retailers of wines in the city of Dublin and other cities and towns within this kingdom (taking advantage that the statute made in this kingdom, in the 28th year of the reign of the late Queen Elizabeth, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook, assignee of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King and Queen's most excellent Majesty on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at the Council-Chamber in Dublin the 14th. day of December, 1691.".
Against selling wine at unreasonable prices.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 193. Wines riching de-.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
